page.title: 01LANDSCAPE - GAZETEER
page.content: LANDSCAPE-GAZETEER. The River Penk runs northwards through the centre of the block occupying a gently sloping valley. There are also a few tributaries of this river. Most of the survey block is used for arable farming as it is fairly fertile land. The block is sparsely populated.Most of the people live in Brewood.The only other settlements are small hamlets, isolated houses, and farms. The main occupation in the area is farming. There is hardly any industry so many of the working people commute to Wolverhampton and other large towns.It is a very quiet area and the residents like it the way it is.
